name: Pumpkin Molasses Mini Muffins
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup canola or melted coconut oil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease mini muffin pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease mini muffin pan.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together canned pumpkin, water, canola or melted coconut oil, ground flaxseed, vanilla, molasses and sugar until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together canned pumpkin, water, canola or melted coconut oil, ground flaxseed, vanilla, molasses and sugar until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In a separate bowl, mix together the spelt flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg with a wooden spoon.
recipeInstructions.name: In a separate bowl, mix together the spelt flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg with a wooden spoon.

recipeInstructions.text: Add wet ingredients to the dry and stir with the wooden spoon until just combined. Do not over mix. The batter will be fairly thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Add wet ingredients to the dry and stir with the wooden spoon until just combined. Do not over mix. The batter will be fairly thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the batter into the mini muffin pan, filling them about 3/4 of the way full.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the batter into the mini muffin pan, filling them about 3/4 of the way full.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 18-20 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean. Let cool for 5-10 minutes, and then serve to your little ones! These also freeze well.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 18-20 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean. Let cool for 5-10 minutes, and then serve to your little ones! These also freeze well.

recipeInstructions.text: Variation: Add mini chocolate chips to the batter before baking.
recipeInstructions.name: Variation: Add mini chocolate chips to the batter before baking.
